text.0_Piyyut, 0_Verse: An introduction of words and the beginning of speech,
text.0_Piyyut, 1_Verse: Firstly, I take authorization and permission;
text.0_Piyyut, 2_Verse: In two or three gates (units, stanzas), which I shall commence in trembling,
text.0_Piyyut, 3_Verse: With permission from Him, Who created [man] and bears [his guilt] till senescence.
text.0_Piyyut, 4_Verse: Eternal mighty acts are His, and there is no sufficient enumeration [for them],
text.0_Piyyut, 5_Verse: [And] were the skies parchment, reed [pen]s all the forests;
text.0_Piyyut, 6_Verse: Were the seas ink and all the assembled waters,
text.0_Piyyut, 7_Verse: The inhabitants of the earth scribes, and writers of rəšūyōṯ (panegyrical hymns);
text.0_Piyyut, 8_Verse: The glory of the Master of heaven and Ruler over the dry land,
text.0_Piyyut, 9_Verse: Who set up the world single-handedly, and holds it in subjugation;
text.0_Piyyut, 10_Verse: And without weariness completed it, and without feebleness,
text.0_Piyyut, 11_Verse: And with a light letter (the letter He), which has no substance (contact between the articulators);
text.0_Piyyut, 12_Verse: He prepared all his work in those six days,
text.0_Piyyut, 13_Verse: The splendor of his honor He elevated onto His throne of fire.
text.0_Piyyut, 14_Verse: A force of millions and myriads [of angels] to serve [Him],
text.0_Piyyut, 15_Verse: They sprout anew in the mornings, abundant is [His] faithfulness;
text.0_Piyyut, 16_Verse: More blazing [than them] are the Seraphim, adorned with six wings,
text.0_Piyyut, 17_Verse: Till they are given a command, they remain silent in stillness;
text.0_Piyyut, 18_Verse: They receive [the command] from one another simultaneously, without delay,
text.0_Piyyut, 19_Verse: The honor of Him Who fills the entire earth to triple in sanctification;
text.0_Piyyut, 20_Verse: Like a voice from the Almighty, like the sound of many waters,
text.0_Piyyut, 21_Verse: Cherubs opposite Ophanim exalt in clamor;
text.0_Piyyut, 22_Verse: To see before [their] face, an appearance like arrows of a bow,
text.0_Piyyut, 23_Verse: Wherever they are sent, they [go] swiftly, in anxiousness;
text.0_Piyyut, 24_Verse: They bless “Blessed be His honor,” in all tongues of incantation,
text.0_Piyyut, 25_Verse: “From the location of the dwelling of His Presence,” which needs no searching;
text.0_Piyyut, 26_Verse: The heavenly hosts roar, acclaim in apprehension,
text.0_Piyyut, 27_Verse: “His reign shines for all generations, in perpetuity;”
text.0_Piyyut, 28_Verse: [When] His sanctification is arranged, and when the hour passes,
text.0_Piyyut, 29_Verse: [That is] the permanent end [of their duty], [which they do not resume] even after seven [years].
text.0_Piyyut, 30_Verse: The lot of the honor of His estate (the Jewish people) is dear [to Him], for they regularly,
text.0_Piyyut, 32_Verse: They are set aside as His portion, to do His will,
text.0_Piyyut, 33_Verse: His wondrous praise they proclaim in speech;
text.0_Piyyut, 34_Verse: He wishes, covets, and desires for them to exert themselves in [His] toil,
text.0_Piyyut, 35_Verse: He therefore accepts their prayer, and [their] plea is effective;
text.0_Piyyut, 36_Verse: It is bound unto the Eternal under oath as a diadem,
text.0_Piyyut, 37_Verse: Opposite His honored frontlet (the head phylactery), it sits in firmness;
text.0_Piyyut, 38_Verse: In which is written with wisdom and knowledge,
text.0_Piyyut, 39_Verse: The greatness of Israel, [who] read in the teachings;
text.0_Piyyut, 40_Verse: The praise of the Master of the universe, a likewise saying:
text.0_Piyyut, 41_Verse: I thought it good to relate it before the kingdoms.
text.0_Piyyut, 42_Verse: [The nations] come and gather, [their] appearance [is] like that of waves,
text.0_Piyyut, 43_Verse: They wonder and ask her about the matter of the signs (wonders);
text.0_Piyyut, 44_Verse: “Whence and who is your Beloved, O fair in appearance?
text.0_Piyyut, 45_Verse: For due to Him, you are killed [in] the lion’s den (the exile);
text.0_Piyyut, 46_Verse: You are honorable and beautiful, if you mingle into [our] dominions,
text.0_Piyyut, 47_Verse: We will do your will in all places;”
text.0_Piyyut, 48_Verse: In wisdom she replies to them, to make known the end,
text.0_Piyyut, 49_Verse: “[If] you knew Him, in recognition [of His omnipotence];
text.0_Piyyut, 50_Verse: Would your greatness be significant vis-à-vis that glory?
text.0_Piyyut, 51_Verse: The greatness He will grant me, when salvation arrives;
text.0_Piyyut, 52_Verse: When light comes to me, and shame will cover you,
text.0_Piyyut, 53_Verse: When His honor is revealed, in strength and pride;
text.0_Piyyut, 54_Verse: He enacts retribution on the foes and the isles,
text.0_Piyyut, 55_Verse: Justice for a beloved people, abounding with merits;
text.0_Piyyut, 56_Verse: Perfect joy, when [the exilees] come [in] neat garments,
text.0_Piyyut, 57_Verse: When He gathers the exiles [to] the city of Jerusalem,
text.0_Piyyut, 58_Verse: He casts His honor on it, day and night,
text.0_Piyyut, 59_Verse: To make His canopy in it, crowned with praise;
text.0_Piyyut, 60_Verse: The splendor of the clouds beautifies the veil,
text.0_Piyyut, 61_Verse: According to [each one’s] work are the booths made [for them];
text.0_Piyyut, 62_Verse: On foldstools of fine gold, with seven tiers;
text.0_Piyyut, 63_Verse: Are the righteous demarcated before Him of the many acts;
text.0_Piyyut, 64_Verse: Their appearance resembles the seven types of joy,
text.0_Piyyut, 65_Verse: The sky in its splendor, and the splendid stars;
text.0_Piyyut, 66_Verse: A glory that lips cannot detail,
text.0_Piyyut, 67_Verse: And which has not been heard nor seen by the prophets [in their] visions;
text.0_Piyyut, 68_Verse: In [a place] that no eye has gazed upon,0 inside the Garden of Eden,
text.0_Piyyut, 69_Verse: They walk in a circle-dance along with the [Divine] Presence;
text.0_Piyyut, 70_Verse: To Him they point, [saying:] “This is Him,” though in awe,
text.0_Piyyut, 71_Verse: “In Him we placed our hope in our captivity, with strong faith;”
text.0_Piyyut, 72_Verse: He leads us in eternity, [we] are compared (in vigor) to maidens,
text.0_Piyyut, 73_Verse: [As] our portion from the Beginning He set aside as a heave;
text.0_Piyyut, 74_Verse: The playful Leviathan and the proud mountain bull (Behemoth),
text.0_Piyyut, 75_Verse: And when they are embroiled with each other and do battle;
text.0_Piyyut, 76_Verse: With His horns, Behemoth gores in greatness,
text.0_Piyyut, 77_Verse: Opposite him, the fish (Leviathan) leaps with his fins in might;
text.0_Piyyut, 78_Verse: His creator pulls him closer with His sword in magnificence,
text.0_Piyyut, 79_Verse: A banquet for the righteous He prepares [from them] and a meal;
text.0_Piyyut, 80_Verse: They recline around Him with tables of carbuncle and precious stones,
text.0_Piyyut, 81_Verse: Drawn out before them are rivers of balsam;
text.0_Piyyut, 82_Verse: And they delight and sate themselves with  intoxicating cups,
text.0_Piyyut, 83_Verse: Sweet wine, guarded in the vat since the Beginning.”
text.0_Piyyut, 84_Verse: O meritorious [ones], just as you heard the praise of this song,
text.0_Piyyut, 85_Verse: So will you have a fixed place in those fellowships (of the righteous in the world to come);
text.0_Piyyut, 86_Verse: And you will merit to sit in the uppermost rank,
text.0_Piyyut, 87_Verse: When you heed His words, uttered in glory;
text.0_Piyyut, 88_Verse: Exalted is God, in the beginning and the end,
text.0_Piyyut, 89_Verse: He took pleasure in us and wanted us, and taught us the Torah.
